snippet: Making secret recordings for the police has grown safer as miniaturization has made modern recorders and transmitters difficult to detect.
abstract: Police tactic of making secret recordings has grown safer as miniaturization has made recorders and transmitters difficult to detect; term 'wearing a wire' is no longer accurate, as devices with wires have largely been replaced by smaller ones, like that worn by New York State Assemblyman Nelson L Castro to record conversations that led to arrest of Assemblyman Eric A Stevenson, who was accused of accepting more than $22,000 in bribes.
lead_paragraph: Making secret recordings for the police has grown safer as miniaturization has made modern recorders and transmitters difficult to detect.
